page.title: 16Organisations in Codsall
page.content: Codsall Gardening Society was formed in 1973 by a small group of keen gardeners and now has 120 members. Aims are to learn about our hobby from Talks -sometimes on one species of plant, others more general, eg. diseases and pests. We make several visits per year to famous gardens or nurseries and have been as far afield as Kew and the Savill Garden at Windsor. We hold one Flower,Fruit and Vegetable Show each year, with mini-competitions at meetings, eg. a "single Dahlia Bloom". The Society participates in the Best Kept Village Competition and has raised money for Compton Hall Hospice.Projects this year include planting Russell Lupins near Russell House in Codsall Square, where they originated. Last year we had a talk from Clay Jones of TV fame and hosted a visit from BBC Radio's "Gardeners Question Time".
